revised_title: Dielectric Absorption Mechanism in the Microwave Region: A New Model
tldr: The authors propose a new model to explain the dielectric absorption mechanism in the microwave region for long-chain aliphatic compounds. The model considers the molecule as consisting of an active group inside a self-consistent molecular field, with the interaction of the active group with the molecular field playing a crucial role. The mechanism involves two distinct types of temperature-dependent and temperature-independent transitions, which cannot be fully explained by the conventional Debye-Frohlich mechanism.
